Text.Value: Well, you're not the most nimble-looking - but seems like it did the trick.
Oh don't you worry - I gave Ketheric a rather nasty poke on Mol's behalf.
Uh, well done on that, though! I'm just focusing on getting the others ready to go.

EditorData.NodeContext: Changing the subject; proud on second sentence as sees himself as being in charge

Text.Value: About Mol - I found her eyepatch.
No... but she'll turn up at some point. That's just how Mol is.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slightly uncertain on "no", then continuing as if convincing himself

Text.Value: Say nothing.
It's all right - I'm sure Mol will be waiting for you at Baldur's Gate.
Be careful - there's still plenty of dangers on the road.
It was a matter of skill - and he was lacking.
So what's the plan now?
I said thank you - what more do you want? I'm a busy man, you know.
Mol's not here with the rest of you?
You'll be leading the way? I doubt it.
Just make sure to keep your wits about you - the city's no playground.
Wish I could've seen you putting Ketheric in his place - must have been quite the spectacle.

EditorData.NodeContext: Measured admiration; doesn't want the player to think he's too impressed

Text.Value: In fact, I bet we'll even get there first.
Yeah, I think you still have some of him on you...

EditorData.NodeContext: Amused (but also a little grossed out)

Text.Value: You think any of those corpses are gonna do it? Well, then - guess it'll have to be me.
Where are the others?
Yes, yes, big hero, got it - I'll keep an eye out.
I'm gonna get everyone to Baldur's Gate safely - and Mol'll be there to welcome us.
The others are in good hands - looking forward to seeing you at Baldur's Gate.
Besides, she wouldn't us to wait for her anyway. Just got to get the others in line, now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bright/determined; knows this to be true if nothing else (and then quickly changes the subject to the adults)

Text.Value: Exactly! And we'll definitely feel her wrath if she thinks we ever doubted her.
Oh you most definitely will, pal.

EditorData.NodeContext: Chuffed at the implication he can handle the task

Text.Value: She is not! Look, get lost, all right? You're letting this hero stuff go to your head.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little too heated on "She is not!" then gathers self into more controlled anger

Text.Value: You and me both! Now I just need to wrangle the others and we'll be on our way.
Why, yes - once Alfira's done with this song, we will be looking for patrons. All coppers welcome, pal.

EditorData.NodeContext: Keen to persuade the player to hand over money if possible

Text.Value: It's all right - I'm sure Mol will be waiting for you at Baldur's Gate.
I'm glad you asked! For now, I've got the others scavenging supplies for the road.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proudly; sees himself as being in charge

Text.Value: I'm putting my own skills to use getting the others ready to leave.
So? It's just Mol's eyepatch. She's lost loads of them. That doesn't mean anything.
Mol's dead - you and I both know it. Death happens. Grow up.
I've put them to use scavenging supplies for the journey.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proudly; sees himself as being in charge

Text.Value: Once they've packed up everything, I'll be leading us all on to Baldur's Gate.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proudly; sees himself as being in charge

Text.Value: On second thoughts, I think we could be earning silver with this song - maybe even gold...
Did you want something or are you just here to stir?
Mol would've shanked him up proper.

EditorData.NodeContext: Fond but slightly wistful (Mol is missing)

Text.Value: Leave.
Mol's dead - you and I both know it. Death happens. Grow up.
I found Mol's eyepatch.
Not likely - you could have gotten hurt.
I crushed him to pulp.
I said get lost, hero.
Pft - I've made it this far, ain't I? Better than some of the adults.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dismissive; clearly thinks he would have been fine

Text.Value: Well done putting Ketheric in his place - couldn't have done it better myself.
If tales aren't told of it for years to come, I'll be disappointed.
I just thought Mol would be here with the rest of you.
Don't think you're gonna get to Baldur's Gate before us - not with me at the helm.
Please - with that smug mug, you're more of a kid than I am.

Synopsis: Mattis is quietly worried by Mol's disappearance but is trying to put a brave face on. In the absence of Alfira and Cerys, he is preparing to lead the tieflings to Baldur's Gate himself.
